intro: Delphinium langxianense, commonly known as the Langxian larkspur, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to China. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family and is characterized by its tall, sparsely branched stems that can reach up to 1.5 meters in height. The plant produces showy, blue to purple flowers arranged in dense spikes, which bloom in late summer. Its leaves are compound, with serrated edges, and the plant prefers well-drained soils in full sun to partial shade. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
